page.title: 06Ecology - Conservation
page.content: Ecology - Conservation & Farming. In this block farmng has not made such an impact on the land as further east. Most farmers consider that they have not needed to greatly increase the amount of natural or artifical fertilisers or pesticides in the lst few years. Some soil washoff has occurred in sloping fields ploughed for winter. Hedges have been retained, with some woodland & scrub as wildlife corners but no new hedges or trees have been planted except for lane-edges or field windbreaks. Old farm ponds have been mostly kept and improved with some new ones made. Many farms have old stone barns, most are well looked after and should provide good summer roosts for bats, and perhaps winter roosts also.
